meanings.definition: The resistance that one surface or object encounters when moving over another.
meanings.sent1: The rough surface created a lot of friction when the box was pushed across it.
meanings.sent2: The wheels of the car spun faster to overcome the friction of the icy road.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy slid across the floor, causing friction with its paws.
meanings.sent4: Their differing opinions created friction between the two friends.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room was palpable, like the friction before a storm.

meanings.definition: Conflict or animosity caused by a clash of wills, temperaments, or opinions.
meanings.sent1: There was friction between the siblings over who got to choose the movie.
meanings.sent2: The friction between the coworkers was evident during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The playful banter between the two friends turned into friendly friction.
meanings.sent4: The friction between the two teams added excitement to the game.
meanings.sent5: The friction between the characters in the story made for a compelling plot.
